thread.title: Coast Guard aware of Russian vessel off East Coast
thread.title_full: Coast Guard aware of Russian vessel off East Coast - The Boston Globe

title: Coast Guard aware of Russian vessel off East Coast
text:
Google+
By Steve Annear Globe Staff February 15, 2017
Officials from the US Coast Guard said they’re aware of a Russian Federation-flagged vessel that was patrolling international waters off the East coast on Wednesday.
Petty officer Jonathan Cinquegrana said in a statement that the ship has not entered US territory, which extends 12 nautical miles out to sea, and the Coast Guard respects “the freedom of navigation exercised by all nations beyond the territorial sea of a coastal state consistent with international law.”
Advertisement
“The Coast Guard continues to coordinate with federal agency partners to monitor maritime contacts operating in the vicinity of US shores,” said Cinquegrana.
In a brief telephone interview, Cinquegrana added there have been no “threatening reports.”
Get Fast Forward in your inbox: Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email. Sign Up Thank you for signing up! Sign up for more newsletters here The ship’s arrival comes just days after Michael Flynn , President Donald J. Trump’s national security adviser, was forced to resign following revelations that he had misled Vice President Mike Pence and White House officials about pre-inauguration phone calls to the Russian ambassador.
While the Coast Guard would not specify the ship’s location, US Representative Joe Courtney, a Connecticut Democrat, said in a statement Wednesday that “a Russian spy ship” was patrolling 30 miles from the US Naval Submarine Base in Groton.
Courtney said the ship’s presence “underscores that the threats posed by a resurgent Russia are real.”
Advertisement
“While I have total confidence in our Navy’s vigilant, responsible readiness, the White House needs to move past their seeming infatuation with [Vladimir] Putin and treat him like the serious threat to global peace and security that he has been for the last five years,” Courtney said .
Courtney told The Hartford Courant that officials have been in touch with the Navy about the vessel, and they are “watching it like a hawk.”
“At this point there’s not a violation of international waters. Unless that happens you aren’t going to see any aggressive push-back,” he told The Courant.
US Representative Rosa DeLauro also called news of a “Russian spy ship” sailing along the coast of Connecticut “alarming.”
“Russia continues to flex its muscle,” she said in a statement. “President Trump has failed to show leadership and condemn Vladimir Putin and his Russian regime.”
Steve Annear can be reached at steve.annear@globe.com . Follow him on Twitter @steveannear . Martin Finucane of the Globe staff contributed to this report.
